bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Alternative Names shi bing 濕病 , moisture disease; shi qi 濕氣 , moisture qi. Pathological Condition that is difficult to cure and hence lasts for an extended period of time. The disease has its seat in the lower parts of the body; it manifests itself through turbid secretions and is often accompanied by a failure of the spleen’s and stomach’s functions of transportation and transformation. Su wen 素問 71: 其病濕，下重 , “The illnesses [caused by] them include moisture with pressure below”.

② Alternative Names shi qi 濕氣 , moisture qi. Etiological Agent. of the evil qi that is capable of bringing forth moisture disease. It includes moisture causing harm from inside, and moisture affecting the body from outside. Su wen 素問 3: 因於濕，首如裹 , “As a result of moisture , the head [feels] as if it were wrapped up”. ③ Illness Sign of local liquid seeping or sweat. Su wen 素問 3: 汗出見濕，乃生痤痱 , “When sweat flows and meets with moisture [from outside the body], this generates acne and seething rashes. ④ Therapeutic Approach of moistening. Ben cao shi yi 本草拾遺 Xu li 序例：濕可去枯 , “ Moistening is able to eliminate dryness”. ⑤ PQ. Ancient criterion of categorizing pharmaceutical substances, referring to drugs with a moistening function. Ben cao shi yi 本草拾遺 Xu li 序例：藥有宣、通、補、泄、 輕、重、澀、滑、燥、濕十種，是藥之大體 , “There are ten types of pharmaceutical drugs, including those that spread, penetrate, supplement, and drain, and those that are able to lift, press down, roughen, smoothen, dry and moisten . These [ten types of functions] include the entire materia medica ”..
